question_sentence: The NBA fined Nets guard Kyrie Irving $50,000 this week. Which of these is a reason why the league said it punished Irving?
choices: Making obscene gestures on the court

question_sentence: “Black-ish” ended a successful run on ABC this week, airing its final episode. What year did the show’s first episode air?
The CDC updated its travel advisory system this week. How many countries are now on its ‘Do Not Travel’ list?
Bald eagles in how many states have died as a result of a recent bird flu outbreak across the U.S.?
Tax Day, usually on April 15, was later this year because:
choices: Of a backlog of old tax returns dating back to 2020
D.C. offices for the IRS were closed to recognize Emancipation Day

question_sentence: TobyKeith – not the singer but a chihuahua from Florida – broke the record for the world's oldest living dog. How old is he?
Some states are aiming at banning these invasive flowering trees that smell like rotting fish and kill plants. What type of tree is it?
The Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival returned after a two-year hiatus. Which of these artists is a headliner this year?
A California bride went viral for her low-cost minimalist wedding. How much did she pay for her dress?
Taco Bell announced the return of popular menu item this week. What is it?
Which new GCSE will be launched in UK schools in September 2025?
evidence: The planned new qualification is the first significant addition to the GCSE curriculum since courses including geology and economics were introduced in 2017. Find out more on The Week Unwrapped podcast

question_sentence: The Queen marked turning how old with a birthday break at Sandringham this week?
evidence: The monarch spent her birthday, on 21 April, at her Norfolk estate’s Wood Farm residence, the home used by her late husband Prince Philip after he stepped down from royal duties

question_sentence: According to forecasts by the International Monetary Fund, which G7 nation will have the slowest economic growth in 2023?
evidence: The UK was the fastest-growing G7 economy in 2021, and is on track for 3.7% growth this year, said the IMF. But GDP growth of only 1.2% in 2023 is forecast for the UK, the lowest predicted rate for any G7 nation

question_sentence: Netflix has reported its first global drop in subscribers since the streaming platform launched in the UK in which year?
evidence: The US company lost 200,000 subscribers globally in its most recent financial quarter, and expects to lose two million more in Q2

question_sentence: What was the previous career of Graham Phillips, the UK-born Kremlin propagandist in Ukraine who interviewed captured British fighter Aiden Aslin?
evidence: Self-described ‘independent journalist’ Phillips has been blogging from countries including Ukraine since quitting the UK civil service in 2010, and has worked for Kremlin-backed broadcaster Russia Today

question_sentence: Joe Root has stepped down as England’s cricket captain after how long in the role?
evidence: Root has had a mixed record in the role, leading his team to the most victories (27) of any Test captain, but also the most defeats (26)

question_sentence: What is the nickname of Russia’s new Sarmat intercontinental ballistic missile?
evidence: The RS-28 Sarmat missile was successfully test-launched this week and is capable of firing up to 15 nuclear warheads in a single strike, according to the Kremlin

question_sentence: Which billionaire has launched a hostile bid to take over social media platform Twitter?
evidence: Tesla boss Musk already has a 9.2% stake in Twitter but has unveiled a financing package totalling more than $43bn to take over the company

question_sentence: A newly released report said Downing Street was targeted in July 2020 by hacking software named after which mythical creature?
evidence: According to Citizen Lab, a research group at the University of Toronto, the Pegasus spyware was used to target phones at Downing Street and the Foreign Office

question_sentence: A newly discovered species of millipede has been named after which pop star?
evidence: The Nannaria swiftae millipede was named in recognition of the chart-topper’s ‘talent as a songwriter and performer’, said Dr Derek Hennen, the lead author of a Virginia Tech study outlining newly discovered species found in Tennessee’s App

question_sentence: About 30,000 runners participated in which popular marathon this week?
evidence: The Boston Marathon took place on Monday for the first time since 2019 due to the coronavirus pandemic. Kenyans dominated both the men’s and women’s races, winning five of the possible six podium spots.

question_sentence: The Biden administration hosted a huge party at the White House on Monday to celebrate what?
evidence: Thousands of people poured onto the White House lawn for the 142nd White House Easter Egg Roll following a 2-year hiatus due to the pandemic. More than 50,000 hard-boiled eggs were used for an epic Easter egg hunt and other activities.

question_sentence: A federal judge this week struck down the Biden administration’s mask mandate that applied to which of the following?
evidence: Masks are no longer required on airplanes and other public transport methods following the judge’s ruling on Monday. The Department of Justice, however, appealed the ruling a few days later — meaning that the Biden administration will now head to a higher court to try to reinstate the mandate.

question_sentence: Some employees who work for one of the world’s biggest companies recently announced their intention to unionize. Which company do they work for?
evidence: Apple store employees in New York City and Atlanta announced they are trying to form a union. Workers say a union is needed because wages have not kept pace with the cost of living. They also want better job protections.

question_sentence: Oscar-nominated actor Johnny Depp took the stand this week in a highly publicized defamation case against which actress?
evidence: Johnny Depp gave detailed and shocking testimony this week in a Fairfax, Virginia court in his defamation case against his ex-wife, actress Amber Heard.

question_sentence: Which automaker said it plans to phase out all gasoline-powered vehicles from its US lineup within the next 10 years?
evidence: Volkswagen said it’s saying goodbye to internal combustion engines and will only sell electric cars in the US within the next decade.

question_sentence: Which US state has the highest number of polluted cities?
evidence: A new US air quality report found the cities that were most polluted by year-round particle pollution were all in California, with Bakersfield topping the list, followed by the Fresno-Madera-Hanford area, Visalia, the San Jose-San Francisco-Oakland area and Los Angeles. About 20.3 million people live in these areas.

question_sentence: Russian and Belarusian athletes will not be allowed to compete in what major sporting event this year?
evidence: Wimbledon organizers announced Russian and Belarusian players will not be allowed to compete at this year’s grand slam following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

question_sentence: How much money has the US committed to Ukraine in assistance since Russia’s invasion began on February 24?
evidence: The US has committed approximately $3.4 billion dollars in assistance to Ukraine since Russia’s invasion began on February 24.

question_sentence: Which streaming platform had a disastrous week after posting its first subscriber loss in more than a decade?
evidence: Netflix’s stock plummeted 35% on Wednesday, wiping more than $50 billion off the value of the company. Netflix said after the close of trading on Tuesday that it shed 200,000 subscribers in the first three months of the year when it had been expecting to add 2.5 million.
